key_problems.text: Severe sinusitis with facial discomfort, nasal congestion, eye pain, and postnasal drip symptoms

pertinent_history.text: Seasonal allergies, possible food allergies, chronic sinusitis, hypertension and history of weight change
Lower extremity vein stripping, tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy
Strong family history for heart disease and alcoholism

objective_findings.text: Turbinate hypertrophy and nasal septum deviation to the left, more significant posteriorly
Normocephalic. No masses or lesions noted
No facial tenderness or asymmetry noted
Pupils are equal, round and reactive to light and accommodation bilaterally. Extraocular movements are intact bilaterally. No nystagmus
Tympanic membranes were noted to be intact. No signs of middle ear effusion or ear canal inflammation

labs_imaging.text: CT of paranasal sinuses identifying mild mucosal thickening of right paranasal sinuses with occlusion of the ostiomeatal complex on the right and turbinate hypertrophy was noted
Audiogram demonstrated mild high frequency sensorineural hearing loss, normal tympanometry, and normal speech discrimination

assessment.text: Probable increasing problems with allergic rhinitis and chronic sinusitis, both contributing to the patient's symptoms

Subjective dizziness, etiology uncertain; however, consider positional vertigo versus vestibular neuronitis as possible ear causes of dizziness, cannot rule out systemic, central or medication or causes at this time
An ENG was ordered to evaluate vestibular function
She was placed on Veramyst nasal spray two sprays each nostril daily and even twice daily if symptoms are worsening
A Medrol Dosepak was prescribed as directed
The patient was given instruction on use of nasal saline irrigation to be used twice daily and Clarinex 5 mg daily was recommended
After the patients' ENG examination, we will see the patient back for further evaluation and treatment recommendations
In light of the patient's atypical dizziness symptoms, I cannot rule out other pathology at this time

If there are any acute changes or problems with regards to her balance or any other acute changes, which she attributes associated with her dizziness, she most likely should pursue an emergent visit to the emergency room
